    {"s":"planar scintigraphy", "p":"represents", "o":"two-dimensional projection image", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"The result is called planar scintigraphy. Essentially, this is a two-dimensional projection image, much like a standard X-ray radiograph, but instead of using transmitted X-rays, we are mapping the distribution of gamma rays emitted from inside the body."},
    {"s":"gamma rays", "p":"passes through", "o":"collimator", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"First, the gamma rays from the patient pass through the collimator, which selects only those photons traveling in defined directions."},
